Running for office has been the honor of a lifetime because of the people I’ve had the privilege to meet. I have such respect for the men and women who took the time to learn about the people asking to represent them in Congress, and I hope I’ve earned their respect in return.
It’s critically important that we return a Republican majority to Congress, and I intend to work with and support @BoHines to make that happen.

I’m so grateful to my wife, Leah, and our three children for supporting me in my run over these past months. And to the dozens of campaign workers who helped me speak directly to tens of thousands of voters: thank you. #ncpol
Another big day out at the early voting sites for our team. So grateful for the sacrifice and hard work of so many! #ncpol https://t.co/nsJfrc8QrV

The media pile-on we’re seeing about what was likely the most challenging period of his life is unseemly.

I stand with Lt. Gov. Robinson #ncpol

Even though this Democratic process has been hijacked by partisan politics, I remain committed to earning the privilege of representing the great people of North Carolina in the United States Congress. (4/4)

Voters deserve to know who their representatives will be and needlessly short-circuiting this process through endless litigation is not helping anyone. It creates greater division in our state and only serves to frustrate voters. (3/4)

As our Constitution requires, the Legislature is the governing body that draws the maps, not activist judges. The rank partisanship on display with the court-imposed congressional map process hurts the people of North Carolina. (2/4)
It’s official! I am running to represent the people of North Carolina’s 13th District in the U.S. Congress. I would be honored to have your support. #ncpol #ncgop #nc13 https://t.co/uoJjSFob7f

We must stand united as Americans to remain free or we risk falling together to fascism and totalitarian control. Our first president, George Washington, warned: “If the freedom of speech is taken away, then dumb and silent we may be led, like sheep, to the slaughter.”

God endowed every American with certain unalienable rights. Along with our rights to life, liberty, and the pursuit of happiness is our sacred right to think what’s in our hearts, say what’s on our minds, gather with our friends and worship as we choose.

The irony here is of epic proportion: @LinkedIn #CENSORED a post in which I quoted from the First Amendment regarding #FreeSpeech and shared a link to a publicly available @joerogan podcast featuring a renowned expert in his field sharing information also publicly available. https://t.co/lNgcjowYdk
